page.title: 18Park Hall
page.content: The History of Park Hall-The Park was originally a park for deer,but now it is a country park for the general public to visit.It covers 435.6 acres at the south east corner of Stoke-on- Trent.It is maintained by six rangers, but only a few of them are there at one time. They range schemes such as fun runs, walks and tours around the park.They provide an information centre which is always open to the general public. There are many types of wildlife in Park hall,but not so common are the Dottard,long-eared owl and lesser- spotted woodpecker.They fly through the park when migrating to the south. There are some rare orchids around the lake and they bloom for two weeks a year.Occasionally a fox or rabbit is found with its leg torn.If badly hurt it is put down,some are taken to a vet.
